medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain located in the right upper quadrant (RUQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started the evening prior to presentation around midnight, sharp and severe, worsened with a deep breath. Patient was unable to sleep due to constant pain that did not improve over time. Had associated nausea without vomiting, fevers, chills, or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Lumbar spinal stenosis s/p L3-L5 laminectomy and fusion; stress urinary incontinence; goiter s/p resection; history of nose bleeds treated with packing.
medical_history.family_history: Brother, nephew, and grandmother all had esophageal or upper GI malignancy.
